title: Boxes - Les boites (2007)
description:
This directorial debut of Jane Birkin is based on Birkin's own family life, chronicling three marriages and the three children she bore from these marriages. The title alludes to the way in which she compartmentalises these relationships and stages of her life.

The audio track is the original mix of English and French dialogues. There are two subtitle tracks, English (srt) with the translations of the French dialogues and French (srt) with the translations of the English dialogues. Both where ripped from the DVD, OCRed into srt-files and muxed back into the MKV container file. The English text was checked carefully and should be ok. The French translation of the English dialogues was done by machine-ocr only. Therefore I included the resulting srt-file and the original sub-file. Maybe some francophile could improve the srt and post it back at

The Making-of extras are like the originals French only without subtitles. 
The trailer has hardcoded French subtitles for the English dialogues.

Don't be fooled by the seemingly low bit rate.  If you use the correct Codec/LAV Filter for x265/HEVC you will get the quality just as on the DVD. It's just the best there is and it workes great for me with VLC-player as well as ZoomPlayer.
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Efficiency_Video_Coding

Format: MKV (Matroska) 692 MiB, 1h 40mn
Overall bit rate: 967 Kbps
Writing application: mkvmerge v8.1.0 ('Psychedelic Postcard') 64bit
Writing library: Lavf55.12.0 
Codec ID: V_MPEGH/ISO/HEVC (High Efficiency Video Coding, x265 1.4)
660 x 576 pixels 
Display aspect ratio 16:10 (=Original)
Frame rate: 25.000 fps (Constant)

Audio: AAC 2 channels 48.0 KHz

Text #1 (Default, English)
UTF-8: engl. text f. french audio parts

Text #2 (Optional, French)
UTF-8: french. text f. engl. audio parts
